de.cocolab.reuse
Class DynArrayObject

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.cocolab.reuse.DynArrayObject
public class DynArrayObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Dynamic flexible arrays of arbitrary element type. While this class will handle basic types such as int, specific classes are provided for those cases - see below.

For comfortable programming use the standard Java Vector class.

For maximum performance you can instead use the static methods of this class. This avoids the cast required on every element access, and gives control of resizing to the programmer. Example: 

      Thing[] list = new Thing[100];
      list = (Thing[])DynArrayObject.extend(list);
      // list is now 200 elements
      x = list[105];
      list[107] = x;

You must remember that resizing the array in this way gives a new object: you must not make copies of the object reference, as after resizing they would refer to the old (smaller) array object.

All methods are final to allow optimisation by Java compilers.

Version:
$Id: $
See Also:
DynArrayBoolean, DynArrayByte, DynArrayChar, DynArrayDouble, DynArrayFloat, DynArrayInt, DynArrayLong, DynArrayShort, Serialized Form

          Returns a copy of array extended by doubling its size.

          Returns a copy of array adjusted to size elements.

Method Detail

resize

public static final java.lang.Object[] resize(java.lang.Object[] array,
                                              int newSize)
Returns a copy of array adjusted to size elements.

Parameters:
array - The old array
newSize - The new size required, which can be larger or smaller than the current size.
Returns:
A new array of the requested size, with elements from the old array copied. The type of this object is the same as the array argument, so it can safely be cast back into the original variable.
See Also:
doubling the current size, halving the current size

extend

public static final java.lang.Object[] extend(java.lang.Object[] array)
Returns a copy of array extended by doubling its size.

Parameters:
array - The old array
Returns:
A new array twice the original size, with elements from the old array copied. The type of this object is the same as the array argument, so it can safely be cast back into the original variable.
See Also:
requesting a specific size, halving the current size

shrink

public static final java.lang.Object[] shrink(java.lang.Object[] array)
Returns a copy of array shrunk by halving its size.

Parameters:
array - The old array
Returns:
A new array half the original size, with elements from the old array copied. The minimum size is one element. The type of this object is the same as the array argument, so it can safely be cast back into the original variable.
See Also:
doubling the current size, requesting a specific size
